info.description: Groups and counts similar errors from cloud services and applications, reports new errors, and provides access to error groups and their associated errors.
info.title: Stackdriver Error Reporting

parameters.description: [Required] The group resource name. Written as projects/projectID/groups/group_name. Call groupStats.list to return a list of groups belonging to this project. Example: projects/my-project-123/groups/my-group
parameters.name: groupName

put.description:
Replace the data for the specified group.
Fails if the group does not exist.

parameters.description: The group resource name. Example: projects/my-project-123/groups/my-groupid
parameters.name: name

delete.description: Deletes all error events of a given project.

parameters.description:
[Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written
as `projects/` plus the
[Google Cloud Platform project
ID](https://support.google.com/cloud/answer/6158840).
Example: `projects/my-project-123`.
parameters.name: projectName

parameters.description: [Required] The group for which events shall be returned.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: [Optional] The maximum number of results to return per response.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: [Optional] A `next_page_token` provided by a previous response.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description:
[Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written
as `projects/` plus the
[Google Cloud Platform project
ID](https://support.google.com/cloud/answer/6158840).
Example: `projects/my-project-123`.
parameters.name: projectName

parameters.description:
[Optional] The exact value to match against
[`ServiceContext.resource_type`](/error-reporting/reference/rest/v1beta1/ServiceContext#FIELDS.resource_type).
parameters.name: serviceFilter.resourceType

parameters.description:
[Optional] The exact value to match against
[`ServiceContext.service`](/error-reporting/reference/rest/v1beta1/ServiceContext#FIELDS.service).
parameters.name: serviceFilter.service

parameters.description:
[Optional] The exact value to match against
[`ServiceContext.version`](/error-reporting/reference/rest/v1beta1/ServiceContext#FIELDS.version).
parameters.name: serviceFilter.version

parameters.description: Restricts the query to the specified time range.
parameters.name: timeRange.period

post.description:
Report an individual error event.

This endpoint accepts **either** an OAuth token,
**or** an [API key](https://support.google.com/cloud/answer/6158862)
for authentication. To use an API key, append it to the URL as the value of
a `key` parameter. For example:

`POST
https://clouderrorreporting.googleapis.com/v1beta1/projects/example-project/events:report?key=123ABC456`

parameters.description:
[Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written
as `projects/` plus the
[Google Cloud Platform project
ID](https://support.google.com/cloud/answer/6158840). Example:
`projects/my-project-123`.
parameters.name: projectName

parameters.description:
[Optional] The alignment of the timed counts to be returned.
Default is `ALIGNMENT_EQUAL_AT_END`.
parameters.name: alignment

parameters.description:
[Optional] Time where the timed counts shall be aligned if rounded
alignment is chosen. Default is 00:00 UTC.
parameters.name: alignmentTime

parameters.description: [Optional] List all ErrorGroupStats with these IDs.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description:
[Optional] The sort order in which the results are returned.
Default is `COUNT_DESC`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description:
[Optional] The maximum number of results to return per response.
Default is 20.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
[Optional] A `next_page_token` provided by a previous response. To view
additional results, pass this token along with the identical query
parameters as the first request.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description: [Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written as projects/ plus the Google Cloud Platform project ID. Example: projects/my-project-123.
parameters.name: projectName

parameters.description:
[Optional] The exact value to match against
[`ServiceContext.resource_type`](/error-reporting/reference/rest/v1beta1/ServiceContext#FIELDS.resource_type).
parameters.name: serviceFilter.resourceType

parameters.description:
[Optional] The exact value to match against
[`ServiceContext.service`](/error-reporting/reference/rest/v1beta1/ServiceContext#FIELDS.service).
parameters.name: serviceFilter.service

parameters.description:
[Optional] The exact value to match against
[`ServiceContext.version`](/error-reporting/reference/rest/v1beta1/ServiceContext#FIELDS.version).
parameters.name: serviceFilter.version

parameters.description: Restricts the query to the specified time range.
parameters.name: timeRange.period

parameters.description:
[Optional] The preferred duration for a single returned `TimedCount`.
If not set, no timed counts are returned.
parameters.name: timedCountDuration

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.
fields.name: fields

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.
key.name: key

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.
oauth_token.name: oauth_token

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.
prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.
quotaUser.name: quotaUser

scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services
View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services

DeleteEventsResponse.description: Response message for deleting error events.

ErrorContext.description:
A description of the context in which an error occurred.
This data should be provided by the application when reporting an error,
unless the
error report has been generated automatically from Google App Engine logs.

sourceReferences.description:
Source code that was used to build the executable which has
caused the given error message.

user.description:
The user who caused or was affected by the crash.
This can be a user ID, an email address, or an arbitrary token that
uniquely identifies the user.
When sending an error report, leave this field empty if the user was not
logged in. In this case the
Error Reporting system will use other data, such as remote IP address, to
distinguish affected users. See `affected_users_count` in
`ErrorGroupStats`.

ErrorEvent.description: An error event which is returned by the Error Reporting system.

eventTime.description:
Time when the event occurred as provided in the error report.
If the report did not contain a timestamp, the time the error was received
by the Error Reporting system is used.

message.description: The stack trace that was reported or logged by the service.

ErrorGroup.description: Description of a group of similar error events.

groupId.description:
Group IDs are unique for a given project. If the same kind of error
occurs in different service contexts, it will receive the same group ID.

ErrorGroupStats.description:
Data extracted for a specific group based on certain filter criteria,
such as a given time period and/or service filter.

affectedServices.description:
Service contexts with a non-zero error count for the given filter
criteria. This list can be truncated if multiple services are affected.
Refer to `num_affected_services` for the total count.

affectedUsersCount.description:
Approximate number of affected users in the given group that
match the filter criteria.
Users are distinguished by data in the `ErrorContext` of the
individual error events, such as their login name or their remote
IP address in case of HTTP requests.
The number of affected users can be zero even if the number of
errors is non-zero if no data was provided from which the
affected user could be deduced.
Users are counted based on data in the request
context that was provided in the error report. If more users are
implicitly affected, such as due to a crash of the whole service,
this is not reflected here.

count.description:
Approximate total number of events in the given group that match
the filter criteria.

firstSeenTime.description:
Approximate first occurrence that was ever seen for this group
and which matches the given filter criteria, ignoring the
time_range that was specified in the request.

lastSeenTime.description:
Approximate last occurrence that was ever seen for this group and
which matches the given filter criteria, ignoring the time_range
that was specified in the request.

numAffectedServices.description:
The total number of services with a non-zero error count for the given
filter criteria.

timedCounts.description:
Approximate number of occurrences over time.
Timed counts returned by ListGroups are guaranteed to be:

- Inside the requested time interval
- Non-overlapping, and
- Ordered by ascending time.

HttpRequestContext.description:
HTTP request data that is related to a reported error.
This data should be provided by the application when reporting an error,
unless the
error report has been generated automatically from Google App Engine logs.

method.description: The type of HTTP request, such as `GET`, `POST`, etc.

referrer.description: The referrer information that is provided with the request.

remoteIp.description:
The IP address from which the request originated.
This can be IPv4, IPv6, or a token which is derived from the
IP address, depending on the data that has been provided
in the error report.

responseStatusCode.description: The HTTP response status code for the request.

userAgent.description: The user agent information that is provided with the request.

ListEventsResponse.description: Contains a set of requested error events.

errorEvents.description: The error events which match the given request.

nextPageToken.description:
If non-empty, more results are available.
Pass this token, along with the same query parameters as the first
request, to view the next page of results.

timeRangeBegin.description: The timestamp specifies the start time to which the request was restricted.

ListGroupStatsResponse.description: Contains a set of requested error group stats.

errorGroupStats.description: The error group stats which match the given request.

nextPageToken.description:
If non-empty, more results are available.
Pass this token, along with the same query parameters as the first
request, to view the next page of results.

timeRangeBegin.description:
The timestamp specifies the start time to which the request was restricted.
The start time is set based on the requested time range. It may be adjusted
to a later time if a project has exceeded the storage quota and older data
has been deleted.

ReportErrorEventResponse.description:
Response for reporting an individual error event.
Data may be added to this message in the future.

ReportedErrorEvent.description: An error event which is reported to the Error Reporting system.

eventTime.description:
[Optional] Time when the event occurred.
If not provided, the time when the event was received by the
Error Reporting system will be used.

message.description:
[Required] The error message.
If no `context.reportLocation` is provided, the message must contain a
header (typically consisting of the exception type name and an error
message) and an exception stack trace in one of the supported programming
languages and formats.
Supported languages are Java, Python, JavaScript, Ruby, C#, PHP, and Go.
Supported stack trace formats are:

* **Java**: Must be the return value of
[`Throwable.printStackTrace()`](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/Throwable.html#printStackTrace%28%29).
* **Python**: Must be the return value of
[`traceback.format_exc()`](https://docs.python.org/2/library/traceback.html#traceback.format_exc).
* **JavaScript**: Must be the value of
[`error.stack`](https://github.com/v8/v8/wiki/Stack-Trace-API) as returned
by V8.
* **Ruby**: Must contain frames returned by
[`Exception.backtrace`](https://ruby-doc.org/core-2.2.0/Exception.html#method-i-backtrace).
* **C#**: Must be the return value of
[`Exception.ToString()`](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.exception.tostring.aspx).
* **PHP**: Must start with `PHP (Notice|Parse error|Fatal error|Warning)`
and contain the result of
[`(string)$exception`](http://php.net/manual/en/exception.tostring.php).
* **Go**: Must be the return value of
[`runtime.Stack()`](https://golang.org/pkg/runtime/debug/#Stack).

ServiceContext.description:
Describes a running service that sends errors.
Its version changes over time and multiple versions can run in parallel.

resourceType.description:
Type of the MonitoredResource. List of possible values:
https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/resources

Value is set automatically for incoming errors and must not be set when
reporting errors.

service.description:
An identifier of the service, such as the name of the
executable, job, or Google App Engine service name. This field is expected
to have a low number of values that are relatively stable over time, as
opposed to `version`, which can be changed whenever new code is deployed.

Contains the service name for error reports extracted from Google
App Engine logs or `default` if the App Engine default service is used.

version.description:
Represents the source code version that the developer provided,
which could represent a version label or a Git SHA-1 hash, for example.
For App Engine standard environment, the version is set to the version of
the app.

SourceLocation.description:
Indicates a location in the source code of the service for which errors are
reported. `functionName` must be provided by the application when reporting
an error, unless the error report contains a `message` with a supported
exception stack trace. All fields are optional for the later case.

filePath.description:
The source code filename, which can include a truncated relative
path, or a full path from a production machine.

functionName.description:
Human-readable name of a function or method.
The value can include optional context like the class or package name.
For example, `my.package.MyClass.method` in case of Java.

lineNumber.description: 1-based. 0 indicates that the line number is unknown.

SourceReference.description:
A reference to a particular snapshot of the source tree used to build and
deploy an application.

repository.description:
Optional. A URI string identifying the repository.
Example: "https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes.git"

revisionId.description:
The canonical and persistent identifier of the deployed revision.
Example (git): "0035781c50ec7aa23385dc841529ce8a4b70db1b"

TimedCount.description:
The number of errors in a given time period.
All numbers are approximate since the error events are sampled
before counting them.

count.description: Approximate number of occurrences in the given time period.

endTime.description: End of the time period to which `count` refers (excluded).

startTime.description: Start of the time period to which `count` refers (included).

TrackingIssue.description: Information related to tracking the progress on resolving the error.

url.description:
A URL pointing to a related entry in an issue tracking system.
Example: https://github.com/user/project/issues/4
